title: Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) Screener
description: Screens for suicidal ideation and behavior to assess suicide risk and guide clinical management. The C-SSRS evaluates both the severity of suicidal ideation and the presence of suicidal behaviors, helping stratify patients into low, moderate, or high risk categories.

parameters.name: ideation_level
parameters.description: Severity of suicidal ideation in the past month (0-5 scale)
options: 3 - Active suicidal ideation with methods (no intent)
4 - Active suicidal ideation with some intent to act
5 - Active suicidal ideation with specific plan and intent

parameters.name: behavior_level
parameters.description: Most severe lifetime suicidal behavior (0-5 scale)

parameters.name: behavior_recent
parameters.description: Timing of most recent suicidal behavior

ranges.interpretation: Low risk for suicide. Consider behavioral health referral at discharge as appropriate. Continue to monitor for changes in ideation or behavior.
Moderate risk for suicide. Recommend behavioral health consultation and implementation of patient safety precautions. Develop safety plan before discharge.
High risk for suicide. Immediate physician and behavioral health notification required. Implement patient safety precautions. Consider psychiatric hospitalization.

references: Posner K, Brown GK, Stanley B, Brent DA, Yershova KV, Oquendo MA, et al. The Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale: initial validity and internal consistency findings from three multisite studies with adolescents and adults. Am J Psychiatry. 2011 Dec;168(12):1266-77. doi: 10.1176/appi.ajp.2011.10111704.

Bjureberg J, Dahlin M, Carlborg A, Edberg H, Haglund A, Runeson B. Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale Screen Version: initial screening for suicide risk in a psychiatric emergency department. Psychol Med. 2022 Dec;52(16):3904-3912. doi: 10.1017/S0033291721000751.

Madan A, Frueh BC, Allen JG, Ellis TE, Rufino KA, Oldham JM, et al. Psychometric Reevaluation of the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale: Findings From a Prospective, Inpatient Cohort of Severely Mentally Ill Adults. J Clin Psychiatry. 2016 Jul;77(7):e867-73. doi: 10.4088/JCP.15m10069.
formula: Risk stratification based on ideation severity and behavior recency
notes: The C-SSRS should not replace a complete clinical evaluation
Any endorsement of suicidal ideation requires follow-up assessment
Consider cultural factors that may influence reporting of suicidal thoughts
Screen can be administered by non-mental health professionals
Validated in multiple populations including adolescents and veterans
